document_data.mainbody:
The Shrine of the Sheaf, later renamed Fox Tower, was a former keep turned into a shrine to Chauntea and later commandeered by bandits in the the midâ€“8 century DR.
The Shrine lay across Buckralams Starn from the road that led into it.
The place was a former keep. It had a courtyard.
The feast hall was lit by candle wheels, and had a minstrels gallery up top. Bedchambers lay beyond the hall, which also connected to the kitchen. Another passage led to the back of the keep, the pantries, and to Beldruns Room, which had once been the abode of a priest and since been converted into furniture storage during the takeover by the Iron Fox. The keep had a front gate.
The place had been a keep originally, and was later converted to a temple of Chauntea. An old priest named Beldrum had once had a room there.
Around , the bandit known as Iron Fox led his forces in seizing the Shrine for as a defensible position from which they could control The Starn. They had some minor repairs done evicted the local priest, Rarendon and kidnapped any local woman they desired.
In the , the Iron Foxs forces were broken and decimated by the combined efforts of the Chosen of Mystra Elminster Aumar and a local woman, Immeira.
